protocol_info.name: BB84 Protocol
protocol_info.description: The first quantum key distribution protocol that enables secure communication using quantum mechanical principles through photon polarization encoding

quantum_channel.definition: A communication channel that can transmit quantum information using individual photons while preserving quantum properties

characteristics.photon_transmission: Individual photons carry quantum bits (qubits) encoded in polarization states
characteristics.quantum_properties: Preserves superposition, entanglement, and maintains quantum coherence during transmission
characteristics.transmission_range: Up to 100+ km in standard fiber optics before losses dominate
characteristics.security_basis: Security derived from fundamental laws of quantum mechanics, not mathematical complexity

vs_classical_channel.classical: Transmits only classical bits (0s and 1s) through electrical or optical pulses
vs_classical_channel.quantum: Transmits quantum states including superpositions like |0⟩+|1⟩ while preserving coherence
vs_classical_channel.information_capacity: Quantum channels can carry both classical and quantum information simultaneously
vs_classical_channel.eavesdropping_detection: Classical channels cannot detect eavesdropping, quantum channels inherently reveal tampering

quantum_gates.definition: Mathematical operations that manipulate quantum states in controlled ways

hadamard_gate.function: Creates superposition states and switches between computational bases
hadamard_gate.role_in_bb84: Switches between rectilinear (Z) and diagonal (X) bases for encoding/measuring

pauli_x_gate.role_in_bb84: Used for state preparation and bit encoding

identity_gate.role_in_bb84: Used when no basis transformation is needed

physical_implementation.optical_gates: Wave plates, polarizing beam splitters, phase modulators
physical_implementation.gate_operations: Polarization rotation, beam splitting, phase shifting
physical_implementation.measurement: Photon detectors that collapse quantum states to classical bits

encoding_process.step2: Alice randomly selects basis (rectilinear or diagonal)
encoding_process.step3: Photon polarized according to bit value and chosen basis
encoding_process.step4: Polarized photon transmitted through quantum channel
encoding_process.step6: Photon detected and quantum state collapses to classical bit

security_foundation.rsa: Mathematical complexity - difficulty of factoring large integers
security_foundation.qkd: Laws of physics - quantum mechanical principles like no-cloning theorem

key_distribution.rsa: Uses public/private key pairs, mathematical algorithms for key exchange
key_distribution.qkd: Direct quantum transmission of shared secret keys using photon polarization

eavesdropping_detection.rsa: Cannot detect passive eavesdropping on key exchange
eavesdropping_detection.qkd: Automatically detects any eavesdropping through quantum measurement disturbance

computational_security.rsa: Vulnerable to quantum computers using Shor's algorithm
computational_security.qkd: Quantum-safe - security increases with quantum computing advances

key_sizes.rsa: Variable key lengths (1024-4096 bits typically), larger keys for more security
key_sizes.qkd: Uses one-time pad with key length equal to message length

implementation.rsa: Software-based, works on standard computer networks
implementation.qkd: Requires specialized quantum hardware - photon sources, detectors, quantum channels

data_transmission_rates.rsa: High data rates possible with standard networking equipment
data_transmission_rates.qkd: Lower key generation rates due to quantum hardware limitations

distance_limitations.rsa: No distance limitations with standard networks
distance_limitations.qkd: Limited by photon loss in transmission medium (currently ~100-500km)

future_proofing.rsa: Will be broken by sufficiently large quantum computers
future_proofing.qkd: Remains secure regardless of computational advances

protocol_steps.title: Random Bit Generation
protocol_steps.description: Alice generates random bit stream and basis choices using quantum random number generators
technical_details: Alice creates random bit string using QRNG (Quantum Random Number Generator)
Alice creates random basis string (0=rectilinear, 1=diagonal)
Each bit has 50% probability of being 0 or 1
Each basis choice is independent and random

protocol_steps.title: Quantum State Preparation & Encoding
protocol_steps.description: Alice encodes bits into photon polarization states using quantum gates
technical_details: Photons prepared in specific polarization states using optical elements
Hadamard gates used to switch between rectilinear and diagonal bases
Pauli-X gates applied for bit-flip operations when needed
Single photons generated using parametric down-conversion or laser diodes

protocol_steps.title: Quantum Channel Transmission
protocol_steps.description: Encoded photons transmitted through quantum channel while preserving quantum properties
technical_details: Individual photons travel through fiber optic or free-space quantum channels
Channel maintains quantum coherence and polarization states
Transmission losses and noise affect but don't compromise security
Channel may be insecure from classical perspective but quantum properties provide protection

protocol_steps.title: Random Quantum Measurement
protocol_steps.description: Bob randomly selects measurement basis and performs quantum measurement on received photons
technical_details: Bob independently generates random basis choices
Quantum measurement performed using polarizing beam splitters and detectors
Measurement basis determines which quantum gate operations are applied
Correct result obtained only when measurement basis matches encoding basis (50% probability)

protocol_steps.title: Basis Reconciliation
protocol_steps.description: Alice and Bob compare basis choices over authenticated classical channel
technical_details: Classical channel communication reveals basis choices but not bit values
Authentication prevents man-in-the-middle attacks on classical communication
Approximately 50% of transmitted bits discarded due to basis mismatch
Remaining bits form the 'sifted key' where bases matched

protocol_steps.title: Error Detection & Eavesdropping Check
protocol_steps.description: Statistical test performed on subset of sifted key to detect eavesdropping
technical_details: Random sample of matching bits compared publicly
Error rate calculated from bit disagreements
Error threshold typically set at 11% (BB84 theoretical limit ~25%)
High error rate indicates eavesdropping attempt - protocol aborted

protocol_steps.title: Error Correction & Privacy Amplification
protocol_steps.description: Final key processing to correct errors and ensure security against partial information leakage
technical_details: Classical error correction algorithms applied to remaining key bits
Privacy amplification reduces key length to eliminate eavesdropper information
Hash functions or other compression techniques used
Final secure key ready for use with one-time pad encryption

quantum_advantages: Unconditional security based on fundamental physics laws
Automatic eavesdropping detection through quantum measurement disturbance
Future-proof against advances in classical and quantum computing
Information-theoretic security independent of computational assumptions
Simultaneous key distribution and security verification
technical_challenges: Requires specialized and expensive quantum hardware
Lower key generation rates compared to classical methods
Susceptible to implementation vulnerabilities in real devices
Need for authenticated classical channel for basis reconciliation
